kdrange_demo

PURPOSE

% Demo of the KDRANGEQUERY function.

SYNOPSIS

This is a script file.

DESCRIPTION 

% Demo of the KDRANGEQUERY function.
%
%   Guy Shechter
%   guy at jhu dot edu

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:

SOURCE CODE 

0001 %% Demo of the KDRANGEQUERY function.
0002 %%
0003 %%   Guy Shechter
0004 %%   guy at jhu dot edu
0005 %%   June 2004
0006 
0007 
0008 
0009 %% Generate a set of 1000 reference datapoints in R^2
0010 ReferencePts = rand(1000,2); 
0011 
0012 %%% Build the k-d Tree once from the reference datapoints.
0013 [tmp, tmp, TreeRoot] = kdtree( ReferencePts, []);
0014 
0015 %%% and find all the points in the k-d tree that are within 0.4
0016 %%% units (D-dimensional Euclidean, 2-norm, distance) from the origin
0017 [ PtsInNeighborhood, Dist ] = kdrangequery( TreeRoot, [.5 0], 0.4 );
0018 if 1==2,
0019     %%% Free the k-D Tree from memory.
0020     kdtree([],[],TreeRoot);
0021 end
0022 
0023 figure; clf; hold on; axis equal
0024 
0025 %% Plot all the points in the k-D tree
0026 plot(ReferencePts(:,1), ReferencePts(:,2),'k.');
0027 
0028 %% Draw a red circle around every point found in the neighborhood
0029 plot(PtsInNeighborhood(:,1), PtsInNeighborhood(:,2), 'ro');
0030 
0031 %% Show the arc with radius=0.4 centered at the origin.
0032 t=0:.01:pi/2;
0033 plot(0.4*cos(t), 0.4*sin(t),'g-','LineWidth',2);
0034
